lead_paragraph: A few days after breaking his hand in rage when China were denied gold on a technicality, coach Benoit Vetu was raising it in triumph after Zhong Tianshi became the first Chinese rider to be crowned world sprint champion on Sunday.

headline.print_headline: Zhong Gold Underlines Chinese Threat in Rio
headline.main: Zhong Gold Underlines Chinese Threat in Rio

snippet: A few days after breaking his hand in rage when China were denied gold on a technicality, coach Benoit Vetu was raising it in triumph after Zhong Tianshi became the first Chinese rider to be crowned world sprint champion on Sunday....
